insurancememberpage.title_a: It's easyâ€”promise. Select your provider below for details on how to apply your insurance to prescription eyeglasses, prescription sunglasses, and eye exams.
insurancememberpage.modal_title: We're not in-network with EyeMed, but it's super simple to apply for reimbursement on prescription eyeglasses and sunglasses after purchasing (and on eye exams, too!). Just follow the steps below :-)
insurancememberpage.modal_pt: Fill out claim form Download it here
insurancememberpage.modal_pt_a: Complete the claim form above and submit it along with your itemized receipt to this address:
insurancememberpage.modal_pt1_a: We'll include a receipt with your shipping confirmation email and with your package, or you can request a receipt at one of our retail stores.
insurancememberpage.modal_pt2_a: Note: Receipts for single-vision glasses with polycarbonate lenses do not break down the cost of frames and lenses separately because they are a $95 packaged item. If your insurance provider has questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to us!
insurancememberpage.modal_pt3_a: After submitting your claim, you'll typically be reimbursed within 2-3 weeks. (Depending on your provider, it can be faster or slower.) The best part: Most insurance plans will cover most or all of your Warby Parker purchase!

productviewpage.howiknowfit: How will i know if these frames fit me?
productviewpage.homevisit: Home visits - as per your convenience
productviewpage.freeorder: Free replacements - exchange over and over

modalweightgroup.line_a: How much does this pair of eyeglasses weight?
modalweightgroup.line_b: This is a relative chart on how light your frames are.
modalweightgroup.line_c: Less than 10 gm: It is feather light. The specs will stay on your face without you realising that you're even wearing them.
modalweightgroup.line_d: 10-20 gm: It is light in weight. The specs will not at all hurt your nose and temples.
modalweightgroup.line_e: 20-40 gm: Average in weight. Most of the frames are in this weight category. And they are not heavy on your nose.
modalweightgroup.line_g: Note: Items are measured by Warehouse staff and values are approximate

modalframegroup.step_1_c: This is the approximate width of a medium Eyeglass, Sunglass
modalframegroup.step_1_d: 2. Stand in front of a mirror.
modalframegroup.step_1_e: Place one tip of the card on center of your nose and touch the other towards the edge of eye.
modalframegroup.step_1_f: 3. Now check the position of the card: -
modalframegroup.step_1_g: If card extends beyond the corner of the eye
modalframegroup.step_1_i: If card roughly touches the corner of the eye
modalframegroup.step_1_k: If card doesn't reach the corner of the eye
modalframegroup.step_2_b: You can easily found the size of frame by looking on the inside of your eyeglass temples (arm pieces). Below you'll find a quick guide to helping you identify your eyeglasses.
modalframegroup.step_2_j: Please note that for some Eyeglasses/Sunglasses the frame size may not follow the above convention
modalframegroup.step_2_k: This is the only information you need when ordering your eyeglass or sunglass frames. If you need assistance identifying your frames, feel free to contact Iris Boutiq and our opticians will be more than happy to help.
modalframegroup.step_3_b: Go for a MEDIUM SIZE frame because it suits 98% of Indian faces.
modalframegroup.step_3_c: If it does not fit, we will pick it up very quickly (no-questions asked) at Zero cost and you will get FULL MONEY BACK.
modalframegroup.step_3_d: We have shipped over 12 Lac orders and less than 2% people have needed to return.
modalframegroup.step_3_e: Lot of frames also have Model Shots on Real Faces - these give a very good idea of frame size.
modalframegroup.step_3_f: Kids less than 10 years must go for Kid Size Frames. Between 10-14 years Kids should go for Small Size Frames.
